meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny - It's your boy, the grok video game reviewer, and I'm here to give you the lowdown on Paper Trail. Now, I know what you're thinking: another puzzle game, yawn. But trust me, this one's got some serious fold-ing (get it?) going on.

First off, let's talk about the art style. It's like someone took all the pretty paper and folded it into a beautiful game. The visuals are stunning, with gorgeous hand-drawn illustrations that'll make you want to grab your favorite origami kit and get creative.

Now, onto the puzzles themselves. They're... fold-y (okay, I'll stop). Seriously though, they're cleverly designed to test your spatial reasoning skills. You'll be folding and sliding paper in all directions, trying to find the right sequence of moves to unlock the next level. It's addictively satisfying when you figure it out, let me tell you.

But don't just take my word for it. The critics are saying some pretty great things about Paper Trail too. Metro GameCentral gave it a solid 70, praising its charming illustrations and perspective-shifting puzzle mechanics. Push Square was equally impressed, calling it "a charming game with an interesting and unique puzzle mechanic." And PlayStation Universe went all in on the game, saying it's "rarely seen in the industry today" - high praise indeed!

Of course, not everyone's a fan of Paper Trail. GameSpew gave it a lower score (70 again), saying that while it looks beautiful, the puzzles can get tiresome. And Softpedia noted that some players might struggle to digest more than a couple levels at a time. But hey, that's what makes life interesting, right?

In conclusion, Paper Trail is a puzzle game that'll keep you engaged and entertained. With its gorgeous visuals, clever level design, and addictive gameplay, it's a must-play for any fan of the genre. So grab your favorite snack, get comfortable, and start folding (just kidding - sort of).
